description.zh-cn: 文化大革命期间，刘永清于1969年3月被下放到宁夏青铜峡五七干校。
description.en: During the Cultural Revolution, Liu Yongqing was sent to the May Seventh Cadre School in Qingtongxia, Ningxia, in March 1969.

description.zh-cn: 胡海峰现任中华人民共和国民政部副部长。
description.en: Hu Haifeng currently serves as Vice Minister of the Ministry of Civil Affairs of the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 胡海青的丈夫是茅道林。
description.en: Hu Haiqing's husband is Mao Daolin.

description.zh-cn: 1998年6月25日，刘永清以胡锦涛夫人身份首次亮相，迎接时任美国总统比尔·克林顿。
description.en: On June 25, 1998, Liu Yongqing made her first public appearance as Hu Jintao's wife to welcome then-U.S. President Bill Clinton.

description.zh-cn: 龚正担任上海市市长期间，陈吉宁担任中共上海市委书记。
description.en: While Gong Zheng serves as Mayor of Shanghai, Chen Jining is the Party Secretary of the CPC Shanghai Committee.

description.zh-cn: 刘鹤曾担任中共中央政治局委员。
description.en: Liu He served as a member of the Politburo of the CPC Central Committee.

description.zh-cn: 在在景山学校完成小学、初中与高中学业。
description.en: Completed primary, junior high, and senior high school education at Beijing Jingshan School.

description.zh-cn: 与许其亮一同担任中共中央军事委员会副主席和中华人民共和国中央军事委员会副主席。
description.en: Served alongside Xu Qiliang as Vice Chairman of the CCP Central Military Commission and the PRC Central Military Commission.

description.zh-cn: 与何卫东一同担任中共中央军事委员会副主席和中华人民共和国中央军事委员会副主席。
description.en: Has been serving alongside He Weidong as Vice Chairman of the CCP Central Military Commission and the PRC Central Military Commission.

description.zh-cn: 张又侠接替范长龙出任中央军事委员会副主席。
description.en: Zhang Youxia succeeded Fan Changlong as Vice Chairman of the Central Military Commission.

description.zh-cn: 张又侠接替常万全出任中国人民解放军总装备部部长。
description.en: Zhang Youxia succeeded Chang Wanquan as Minister of the PLA General Armament Department.

description.zh-cn: 李尚福接替张又侠，出任中央军委装备发展部部长。
description.en: Li Shangfu succeeded Zhang Youxia as Minister of the CMC Equipment Development Department.

description.zh-cn: 2012年，时任沈阳军区司令员的张又侠陪同国防部长梁光烈访问美国。
description.en: In 2012, Zhang Youxia, then Commander of the Shenyang Military Region, accompanied Minister of National Defense Liang Guanglie on a visit to the United States.

description.zh-cn: 作为连长参加1979年中越战争，并因表现出色获得晋升。
description.en: Participated in the 1979 Sino-Vietnamese War as a company commander and was promoted for his outstanding performance.

description.zh-cn: 李宗仁与白崇禧、黄绍竑合作，统一广西全省，是新桂系的核心领导人物。
description.en: Li Zongren cooperated with Bai Chongxi and Huang Shaohong to unify the entire province of Guangxi; they were the core leaders of the New Guangxi clique.

description.zh-cn: 周恩来促成并具体安排了李宗仁于1965年从海外返回中国大陆，并在“文化大革命”期间对他予以保护。
description.en: Zhou Enlai facilitated and specifically arranged for Li Zongren's return from overseas to mainland China in 1965, and provided him with protection during the Cultural Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 李宗仁是新桂系军阀集团的首领。
description.en: Li Zongren was the leader of the New Guangxi clique warlord group.

description.zh-cn: 习近平在2002年至2007年任中共浙江省委书记期间，黄坤明先后主政湖州、嘉兴，是其下属。黄坤明被认为是习近平的重要亲信之一。
description.en: While Xi Jinping was the Party Secretary of Zhejiang from 2002 to 2007, Huang Kunming served as the head of Huzhou and Jiaxing, making him a subordinate. Huang is considered a key confidant of Xi.

description.zh-cn: 习近平出任中共中央总书记后不久，将黄坤明上调至中共中央宣传部任职。
description.en: Shortly after Xi Jinping became General Secretary of the CPC Central Committee, he promoted Huang Kunming to a position in the Central Propaganda Department.

description.zh-cn: 1999年，黄坤明与时任三明市市长蔡奇一同被调往浙江省任职。
description.en: In 1999, Huang Kunming, along with Cai Qi, who was then the mayor of Sanming, were both transferred to Zhejiang Province.

description.zh-cn: 在刘奇葆担任中共中央宣传部部长期间，黄坤明担任其副手。
description.en: While Liu Qibao was the Minister of the Central Propaganda Department, Huang Kunming served as his deputy.

description.zh-cn: 黄坤明接替刘奇葆出任中共中央宣传部部长。
description.en: Huang Kunming succeeded Liu Qibao as the Minister of the Central Propaganda Department.

description.zh-cn: 据《南华早报》原主编王向伟撰文称，黄坤明曾于2022年底向习近平反映尽快结束清零政策的紧迫性，从而间接推动了该政策的终结。
description.en: According to an article by Wang Xiangwei, former editor-in-chief of the South China Morning Post, Huang Kunming reported the urgency of ending the zero-COVID policy to Xi Jinping at the end of 2022, thereby indirectly contributing to its termination.

description.zh-cn: 胡锦涛曾坚决反对女儿胡海清出国留学，并在其擅自前往比利时后，勒令其回国。
description.en: Hu Jintao strongly opposed his daughter Hu Haiqing's plan to study abroad and ordered her to return to China after she went to Belgium without his permission.

description.zh-cn: 移居美国后，茅道临与妻子胡海清拒绝了岳父胡锦涛多次要求他们回国的请求。
description.en: After moving to the United States, Mao Daolin and his wife Hu Haiqing refused his father-in-law Hu Jintao's repeated requests for them to return to China.

description.zh-cn: 尉健行将金铮反映的关于胡海清承包医院一事转告了胡锦涛。
description.en: Wei Jianxing relayed the information from Jin Zheng about Hu Haiqing's contracting of the hospital to Hu Jintao.

description.zh-cn: 梁思成与林徽因于1928年结婚，直至1955年林徽因逝世。
description.en: Liang Sicheng married Lin Huiyin in 1928, and they remained married until her death in 1955.

description.zh-cn: 文化大革命期间，梁思成被作为“反动学术权威”受到批判、抄家和迫害，最终在贫病交加中去世。
description.en: During the Cultural Revolution, Liang Sicheng was persecuted as a 'reactionary academic authority', criticized, his home was ransacked, and he eventually died in poverty and illness.

description.zh-cn: 抗日战争爆发后，梁思成为躲避战乱，被迫离开北平，携全家前往西南地区。
description.en: After the outbreak of the Second Sino-Japanese War, Liang Sicheng was forced to leave Beiping and flee to the southwest with his family to escape the war.

position.en: Head of the Department of Architecture at Northeastern University

description.zh-cn: 梁思成在东北大学任教时，张学良时任该校校长。
description.en: When Liang Sicheng taught at Northeastern University, Zhang Xueliang was the president of the university.

position.zh-cn: 晋军军官、第二战区北路军总司令
position.en: Jin Army Officer, Commander of the Northern Route Army of the Second War Area

description.zh-cn: 傅作义毕业后加入阎锡山领导的晋军，长期在其麾下任职，直至1938年12月出任第八战区副司令长官后摆脱其控制。
description.en: After graduation, Fu Zuoyi joined the Jin Army led by Yan Xishan and served under him for a long time, until he broke free from his control after being appointed Deputy Commander of the Eighth War Area in December 1938.

description.zh-cn: 傅作义仿照中国共产党领导的八路军的建军经验，在其部队中成立政治工作机构，并制定类似《三大纪律八项注意》的纪律。
description.en: Fu Zuoyi modeled the army-building experience of the Eighth Route Army led by the Communist Party of China, establishing political work agencies in his troops and formulating disciplines similar to the 'Three Main Rules of Discipline and Eight Points for Attention'.

description.zh-cn: 傅冬是傅作义的长女。
description.en: Fu Dong is Fu Zuoyi's eldest daughter.

description.zh-cn: 傅冬作为中共地下党员，在其父傅作义身边工作，不断进行劝说，为促成北平和平解放起了重要作用。
description.en: As an underground member of the CCP, Fu Dong worked alongside her father Fu Zuoyi and continuously persuaded him, playing a crucial role in bringing about the peaceful liberation of Beiping.

position.zh-cn: 水利部/水利电力部部长
position.en: Minister of Water Resources / Minister of Water Resources and Electric Power

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国成立后，傅作义长期担任水利部及后来的水利电力部部长，是时任国务院总理周恩来的下属。
description.en: After the founding of the People's Republic of China, Fu Zuoyi served for a long time as the Minister of Water Resources and later the Minister of Water Resources and Electric Power, subordinate to then-Premier Zhou Enlai.

description.zh-cn: 文化大革命爆发之初，周恩来将傅作义列入应予保护的干部名单中，对其进行保护。
description.en: At the beginning of the Cultural Revolution, Zhou Enlai included Fu Zuoyi in a list of cadres to be protected, thereby protecting him.

description.zh-cn: 在第二次国共内战期间，傅作义作为国民党高级将领，与毛泽东领导的共产党军队为敌，并曾发表致毛泽东的公开电进行谴责。
description.en: During the Second Chinese Civil War, Fu Zuoyi, as a high-ranking Nationalist general, was an enemy of the Communist forces led by Mao Zedong and once issued a public telegram condemning him.

description.zh-cn: 宋子文是孔祥熙的妻弟。
description.en: T. V. Soong was H. H. Kung's brother-in-law.

description.zh-cn: 在哥伦比亚大学研究所就读。
description.en: Attended graduate school at Columbia University.

description.zh-cn: 宋子文曾多次担任行政院副院长、代理院长及院长职务。
description.en: T. V. Soong served multiple times as Vice Premier, Acting Premier, and Premier of the Executive Yuan.

description.zh-cn: 1935年4月起，宋子文接任中国银行董事长。
description.en: From April 1935, T. V. Soong took over as the Chairman of the Bank of China.

description.zh-cn: 宋子文与张学良是好友，曾在西安事变中出面调解。
description.en: T. V. Soong and Zhang Xueliang were friends, and Soong mediated during the Xi'an Incident.

description.zh-cn: 1945年，宋子文赴苏联同斯大林会谈，并签订《中苏友好同盟条约》。
description.en: In 1945, T. V. Soong went to the Soviet Union to meet with Stalin and sign the Sino-Soviet Treaty of Friendship and Alliance.

description.zh-cn: 据称杜鲁门曾大骂宋家为“贼”，但此说法的真实性存疑。
description.en: Truman allegedly called the Soong family 'thieves,' although the authenticity of this claim is disputed.

description.zh-cn: 宋子文与时任美国总统罗斯福会谈，罗斯福表示愿意向中国提供援助。
description.en: T. V. Soong met with then-U.S. President Roosevelt, who expressed willingness to provide aid to China.

description.zh-cn: 宋子文是宋氏家族的核心成员之一。
description.en: T. V. Soong was one of the core members of the Soong family.

description.zh-cn: 太平公主是唐高宗李治的女儿。
description.en: Princess Taiping was the daughter of Emperor Gaozong of Tang (Li Zhi).

description.zh-cn: 太平公主是武则天的女儿。
description.en: Princess Taiping was the daughter of Wu Zetian.

description.zh-cn: 太平公主是唐中宗李显的妹妹。
description.en: Princess Taiping was the younger sister of Emperor Zhongzong of Tang (Li Xian).

description.zh-cn: 太平公主是李弘的妹妹。
description.en: Princess Taiping was the younger sister of Li Hong.

description.zh-cn: 太平公主与上官婉儿一同草拟中宗遗诏，在上官婉儿被杀后，太平公主十分哀伤，并出资厚葬及搜集其文集。
description.en: Princess Taiping and Shangguan Wan'er jointly drafted Emperor Zhongzong's final edict. After Shangguan Wan'er's execution, Princess Taiping was deeply saddened, funded her grand burial, and collected her literary works.

description.zh-cn: 汉景帝刘启是汉文帝刘恒的长子。
description.en: Emperor Jing (Liu Qi) was the eldest son of Emperor Wen (Liu Heng).

description.zh-cn: 平定七国之乱后，周亚夫因与汉景帝意见不合而遭猜忌，后被以谋反罪下狱，绝食而死。
description.en: After suppressing the Rebellion of the Seven States, Zhou Yafu was suspected by Emperor Jing due to disagreements, later imprisoned on charges of treason, and died on a hunger strike.

description.zh-cn: 汉武帝刘彻是汉景帝的儿子。
description.en: Emperor Wu (Liu Che) was the son of Emperor Jing.

description.zh-cn: 周亚夫在汉景帝时期先后担任太尉（前154-前149）和丞相（前150-前147）。
description.en: Zhou Yafu served Emperor Jing successively as Grand Marshal (154-149 BCE) and Chancellor (150-147 BCE).

description.zh-cn: 艾未未是诗人艾青的儿子。
description.en: Ai Weiwei is the son of the poet Ai Qing.

description.zh-cn: 艾未未于1978年入读北京电影学院动画系。
description.en: Ai Weiwei enrolled in the Animation Department of the Beijing Film Academy in 1978.

description.zh-cn: 中国当局于2011年4月3日将艾未未秘密关押81天，释放后发起“发课税案”对其进行打压，并扣押其护照直至2015年7月。
description.en: Chinese authorities secretly detained Ai Weiwei for 81 days starting April 3, 2011. After his release, they launched the 'Fake Tax Case' to suppress him and confiscated his passport until July 2015.

description.zh-cn: 据报道，时任北京市公安局局长傅政华主导了对艾未未的审讯和迫害。
description.en: According to reports, Fu Zhenghua, then director of the Beijing Municipal Public Security Bureau, led the interrogation and persecution of Ai Weiwei.

description.zh-cn: 浦志强作为发课公司的代理律师，在“发课税案”中为艾未未方提供法律辩护。
description.en: As the legal counsel for Fake Ltd., Pu Zhiqiang provided legal defense for Ai Weiwei's side in the 'Fake Tax Case'.

description.zh-cn: 胤祥因对雍正朝的巨大贡献，获雍正帝赐予其爵位世袭罔替的恩典，成为清朝第九位铁帽子王。
description.en: Due to his immense contributions to the Yongzheng court, Yinxiang was granted the privilege of a perpetually hereditary peerage by the Yongzheng Emperor, becoming the ninth 'iron-cap' prince of the Qing dynasty.

description.zh-cn: 孙策是孙坚的长子。
description.en: Sun Ce is the eldest son of Sun Jian.

description.zh-cn: 孙权是孙策的二弟。
description.en: Sun Quan is Sun Ce's younger brother.

description.zh-cn: 周瑜在攻克皖城后娶小桥为妻。
description.en: Zhou Yu married Xiao Qiao after conquering Wan Castle.

description.zh-cn: 孙策在父亲孙坚死后，为讨回旧部曾一度在袁术麾下效力。
description.en: After his father Sun Jian's death, Sun Ce briefly served under Yuan Shu to reclaim his father's former troops.

description.zh-cn: 袁术僭越称帝后，孙策与其断绝关系，并参与了对袁术的讨伐。
description.en: After Yuan Shu declared himself emperor, Sun Ce broke ties with him and participated in the campaign against him.

position.en: General Who Attacks Rebels, Marquis of Wu

description.zh-cn: 因孙策讨伐袁术有功，曹操表奏朝廷授予孙策讨逆将军官职并加封为吴侯。
description.en: Due to Sun Ce's merits in the campaign against Yuan Shu, Cao Cao petitioned the court to grant Sun Ce the title of 'General Who Attacks Rebels' and ennoble him as the Marquis of Wu.

description.zh-cn: 太史慈原为刘繇部下，在神亭岭与孙策交战。后被孙策俘获，孙策亲自为其松绑并委以重任，太史慈遂归顺。
description.en: Tai Shi Ci initially served Liu Yao and fought Sun Ce at Shenting Ridge. He was later captured by Sun Ce, who personally untied him and entrusted him with important tasks, leading to Tai Shi Ci's allegiance.

description.zh-cn: 孙权称帝后，追谥其兄孙策为长沙桓王。
description.en: After ascending the throne, Sun Quan posthumously honored his elder brother Sun Ce as Prince Huan of Changsha.

description.zh-cn: 在担任中央外事工作委员会办公室主任期间，向中共中央总书记习近平汇报工作。
description.en: As Director of the Office of the Central Foreign Affairs Commission, he reported to CCP General Secretary Xi Jinping.

description.zh-cn: 在担任国务委员期间，向时任国务院总理李克强汇报工作。
description.en: As a State Councilor, he reported to then-Premier of the State Council Li Keqiang.

description.zh-cn: 在担任外交部长期间，向时任国务院总理温家宝汇报工作。
description.en: As Minister of Foreign Affairs, he reported to then-Premier of the State Council Wen Jiabao.

description.zh-cn: 受文化大革命的影响，杨洁篪于1968年被迫中止学业。
description.en: Affected by the Cultural Revolution, Yang Jiechi was forced to drop out of school in 1968.

description.zh-cn: 1972年尼克松访华后，周恩来指示加速培养外语人才，杨洁篪因此被选中派到国外留学。
description.en: After Nixon's visit to China in 1972, Zhou Enlai instructed to accelerate the training of foreign language talents, which led to Yang Jiechi being selected to study abroad.

description.zh-cn: 根据1971年毛泽东的指示精神，中国选拔了一批学生到国外留学，杨洁篪是其中之一。
description.en: Following Mao Zedong's instructions in 1971, China selected a group of students to study abroad, and Yang Jiechi was among them.

description.zh-cn: 为杨洁篪取了“老虎杨”（Tiger Yang）的绰号。
description.en: Gave Yang Jiechi the nickname 'Tiger Yang'.

description.zh-cn: 1977年，乔治·H·W·布什访问中国时，杨洁篪担任其全程陪同翻译。
description.en: In 1977, when George H. W. Bush visited China, Yang Jiechi served as his full-time accompanying interpreter.

description.zh-cn: 在华兴会中，宋教仁担任副会长，会长为黄兴。
description.en: In the Huaxinghui, Song Jiaoren served as Vice President under President Huang Xing.

description.zh-cn: 宋教仁支持孙中山成立中国同盟会，并担任司法部检事长。
description.en: Song Jiaoren supported Sun Yat-sen in establishing the Tongmenghui and served as the Procurator of its Judicial Department.

description.zh-cn: 1903年8月，宋教仁与黄兴在武昌相识，从此成为挚友。
description.en: In August 1903, Song Jiaoren and Huang Xing met in Wuchang and became close friends thereafter.

description.zh-cn: 宋教仁倡导的责任内阁制威胁到袁世凯的统治地位。时人普遍认为，袁世凯授意或幕后策划了对国民党领袖宋教仁的暗杀，以阻止其组阁。
description.en: The cabinet responsibility system advocated by Song Jiaoren threatened Yuan Shikai's ruling position. It was widely believed at the time that Yuan Shikai ordered or masterminded the assassination of Kuomintang leader Song Jiaoren to prevent him from forming a cabinet.

description.zh-cn: 在1958年的军委扩大会议上，彭德怀等人将刘伯承作为军事教条主义的代表进行批判。
description.en: At the enlarged meeting of the Military Commission in 1958, Peng Dehuai and others criticized Liu Bocheng as a representative of military dogmatism.

description.zh-cn: 在抗日战争期间，刘伯承担任八路军129师师长，领导开辟晋冀鲁豫边区，并指挥了百团大战等多项重要战役。
description.en: During the Second Sino-Japanese War, Liu Bocheng served as the commander of the 129th Division of the Eighth Route Army, led the establishment of the Shanxi-Hebei-Shandong-Henan border region, and commanded many important campaigns, including the Hundred Regiments Offensive.

description.zh-cn: 倪震是亦舒的侄子。
description.en: Joe Nieh is Yi Shu's nephew.

description.zh-cn: 周慧敏是亦舒的侄媳。
description.en: Vivian Chow is Yi Shu's niece-in-law.

description.zh-cn: 于1993年移民加拿大。
description.en: Immigrated to Canada in 1993.

description.zh-cn: 亦舒的科幻作品不时会看到兄长倪匡作品的角色客串出现。
description.en: Characters from her elder brother Ni Kuang's works occasionally make guest appearances in Yi Shu's science fiction works.

description.zh-cn: 袁隆平在1960年目睹大饥荒的惨状后，深受刺激，决意研究提高粮食产量。
description.en: After witnessing the devastating effects of the Great Famine in 1960, Yuan Longping was deeply moved and resolved to research ways to increase grain production.

description.zh-cn: 在文革期间，袁隆平遭到红卫兵和群众批判，其实验稻田的育种甚至被恶意拔除。
description.en: During the Cultural Revolution, Yuan Longping was criticized by Red Guards and the masses, and his experimental rice paddies were even maliciously uprooted.

description.zh-cn: 英国东印度公司向中国走私鸦片是导致战争的根本原因之一。
description.en: The British East India Company's smuggling of opium into China was one of the root causes of the war.

description.zh-cn: 根据《南京条约》，清朝将香港岛割让给大英帝国。
description.en: Under the Treaty of Nanking, the Qing dynasty ceded Hong Kong Island to the British Empire.

description.zh-cn: 南昌起义后，中国共产党开始建立自己的正式武装部队，即中国工农红军。
description.en: After the Nanchang Uprising, the Chinese Communist Party began to establish its own formal armed forces, the Chinese Workers' and Peasants' Red Army.

description.zh-cn: 苏军在1946年撤离东北前，将缴获的日本关东军武器移交给林彪的东北野战军，为中共抢占东北提供了便利。
description.en: Before withdrawing from Northeast China in 1946, the Soviet Army handed over captured weapons from the Japanese Kwantung Army to Lin Biao's Northeast Field Army, facilitating the CCP's occupation of the region.

description.zh-cn: 苏联政府正式照会中国外交部，决定召回全部在华工作的1390名苏联专家，并终止了数百份经济和科技合作合同，使中苏关系走向破裂。
description.en: The Soviet government officially notified the Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs of its decision to recall all 1390 Soviet experts working in China and terminated hundreds of economic and technological cooperation contracts, leading to the rupture of Sino-Soviet relations.

description.zh-cn: 文化大革命期间，毛泽东号召“反苏修”，中苏两国关系彻底冻结，冲突升级。
description.en: During the Cultural Revolution, Mao Zedong called for "opposing Soviet revisionism," which completely froze Sino-Soviet relations and escalated the conflict.

description.zh-cn: 在苏联考虑对中国进行核打击时，时任美国总统尼克松及其政府进行了干预，向苏联表明美国不会容忍此类行为，从而阻止了潜在的核攻击。
description.en: When the Soviet Union considered a nuclear strike against China, then-U.S. President Nixon and his administration intervened, indicating to the Soviets that the U.S. would not tolerate such an action, thereby preventing a potential nuclear attack.

description.zh-cn: 在中共早期，斯大林不信任毛泽东，支持“二十八个半布尔什维克”等苏联路线的领导人，并将毛泽东排除在中央委员会之外。
description.en: In the early days of the CCP, Stalin distrusted Mao Zedong, supported leaders who followed the Soviet line, such as the "28 Bolsheviks," and excluded Mao from the Central Committee.

description.zh-cn: 改革开放带来的思想解放、对西方民主观念的接触以及对政治体制改革的讨论，为八六学潮的发生提供了重要的社会和思想背景。
description.en: The intellectual liberation, exposure to Western democratic concepts, and discussions on political system reform brought by the Reform and Opening-up provided a significant social and ideological background for the 1986 student demonstrations.

description.zh-cn: 时任中国科学技术大学副校长方励之在校内的竞选演讲中，宣扬民主需要靠自己争取，其言论和公开支持极大地鼓舞了学生，推动了学潮的发生和发展。
description.en: In his campaign speech at the university, then-Vice President Fang Lizhi advocated that democracy must be fought for, which greatly inspired the students and propelled the outbreak and development of the demonstrations.

description.zh-cn: 八六学潮为1989年的六四事件埋下伏笔，部分学潮的参与者后来也成为六四事件的发起人和组织者。
description.en: The 1986 student demonstrations set the stage for the 1989 Tiananmen Square protests, and some of its participants later became initiators and organizers of the 1989 events.

description.zh-cn: 邓小平在1980年代实际主导最高决策，决定并推动了废除干部领导职务终身制这项重要的政治制度改革。
description.en: Deng Xiaoping, as the paramount leader in the 1980s, decided on and promoted the abolition of the lifelong tenure system for leading cadres, an important political system reform.

description.zh-cn: 中央顾问委员会作为一项过渡性制度安排，通过安置老干部，为废除领导职务终身制铺平了道路。
description.en: As a transitional institutional arrangement, the Central Advisory Commission paved the way for the abolition of the lifelong tenure system by accommodating veteran cadres.

description.zh-cn: 胡锦涛在中共十八大上卸任所有职务，实现“裸退”，被习近平称赞为“高风亮节”，此举被视为进一步完善了废除干部领导职务终身制的制度。
description.en: Hu Jintao stepped down from all positions at the 18th CPC National Congress, achieving a 'naked retirement,' which was praised by Xi Jinping as a 'noble act' and seen as a further step in perfecting the system of abolishing lifelong tenure for cadres.

position.zh-cn: 中共中央总书记、中共中央军委主席
position.en: General Secretary of the CPC Central Committee, Chairman of the CPC Central Military Commission

description.zh-cn: 在中共十八大上，习近平接替胡锦涛，成为中国共产党的主要领导人。
description.en: At the 18th CPC National Congress, Xi Jinping succeeded Hu Jintao to become the primary leader of the Communist Party of China.

description.zh-cn: 取消国家主席任期限制的修宪被普遍认为是习近平为了谋求长期执政而推动的举动。
description.en: The constitutional amendment to remove the presidential term limit is widely seen as a move pushed by Xi Jinping to secure long-term rule.

description.zh-cn: 该修正案取消了国家主席的任期限制，此举被外界解读为对邓小平时代确立的废除领导干部职务终身制原则的逆转，有媒体认为干部领导职务终身制已经复辟。
description.en: This amendment removed the term limit for the President, a move interpreted by outsiders as a reversal of the principle of abolishing lifelong tenure established during the Deng Xiaoping era, with some media suggesting the lifelong system has been restored.

description.zh-cn: 江泽民在主政期间延续了废除干部领导职务终身制的政策。
description.en: During his tenure, Jiang Zemin continued the policy of abolishing the lifelong tenure system for leading cadres.

description.zh-cn: 鲁迅在观看日俄战争中中国人作俄军间谍被日军处决的幻灯片后，认识到改变国民精神的重要性，从而决定弃医从文。
description.en: After watching a slide show depicting a Chinese person being executed by the Japanese army as a Russian spy during the war, Lu Xun realized the importance of changing the national spirit and decided to abandon medicine for literature.

description.zh-cn: 担任日俄战争时期大日本帝国的国家元首和名义上的最高统帅。
description.en: Served as the head of state and nominal commander-in-chief of the Empire of Japan during the Russo-Japanese War.

description.zh-cn: 担任日俄战争时期俄罗斯帝国的国家元首和最高统帅。
description.en: Served as the head of state and commander-in-chief of the Russian Empire during the Russo-Japanese War.

description.zh-cn: 清零政策是为应对2019冠状病毒病疫情而采取的一种防疫策略。
description.en: The zero-COVID policy was an epidemic prevention strategy adopted in response to the COVID-19 pandemic.

description.zh-cn: 公开表示中国的清零政策不可持续。
description.en: Publicly stated that China's zero-COVID policy was unsustainable.

description.zh-cn: 公开表示不认为中国大陆推行的清零政策可以持久进行。
description.en: Publicly stated that he did not believe the zero-COVID policy pursued by mainland China was sustainable.

description.zh-cn: 公开承认变种病毒毒力减弱，表示中国疫情处于“新形势新任务”，提早宣布了清零政策开始松动。
description.en: Publicly acknowledged the weakening virulence of the virus variant, stating that China's epidemic was in a 'new situation with new tasks', thus pre-announcing the loosening of the zero-COVID policy.

description.zh-cn: 据路透社报道，在执行宽松防疫措施后，习近平希望放缓开放，但李强反驳了习近平的要求，并继续推动放宽政策。
description.en: According to Reuters, after implementing relaxed epidemic measures, Xi Jinping wished to slow down the reopening, but Li Qiang rebutted his request and continued to push for policy relaxation.

description.zh-cn: 据媒体人士王向伟透露，时任中共广东省委书记黄坤明曾向习近平反映尽快结束清零政策的紧迫性，间接推动了政策终结。
description.en: According to media personality Wang Xiangwei, Huang Kunming, then Party Secretary of Guangdong, reported to Xi Jinping on the urgency of ending the zero-COVID policy, indirectly contributing to its termination.

description.zh-cn: 在回应谭德塞对清零政策的批评时，时任外交部发言人赵立坚警告对方“不要发表不负责任的言论”。
description.en: In response to Tedros's criticism of the zero-COVID policy, then-Foreign Ministry spokesman Zhao Lijian warned him 'not to make irresponsible remarks'.

description.zh-cn: 越南在2021年底放弃了清零政策。
description.en: Vietnam abandoned the zero-COVID policy in late 2021.

description.zh-cn: 慈禧太后因仇视外国势力，从默许纵容转向公开支持义和团，并最终决定向十一国宣战，将义和团运动推向高潮。
description.en: Driven by her hostility towards foreign powers, Empress Dowager Cixi's stance shifted from tacit approval to open support for the Boxers, eventually deciding to declare war on eleven nations, thus pushing the Boxer Rebellion to its climax.

description.zh-cn: 义和团运动的失败直接导致清政府被迫与十一国签订《辛丑条约》，承担巨额赔款及丧失多项主权。
description.en: The failure of the Boxer Rebellion directly led to the Qing government being forced to sign the Boxer Protocol with eleven nations, incurring massive indemnities and the loss of various sovereign rights.

description.zh-cn: 甲午战争战败后，西方列强在中国划分势力范围，加剧了社会矛盾和排外情绪，为义和团运动的兴起提供了背景。
description.en: After the defeat in the First Sino-Japanese War, Western powers carved out spheres of influence in China, exacerbating social tensions and anti-foreign sentiment, which provided the backdrop for the rise of the Boxer Rebellion.

description.zh-cn: 事件后，邓小平被错误地认定为幕后总指挥，导致其被撤销党内外一切职务。
事件后，中共中央政治局通过决议，任命华国锋为中共中央第一副主席和国务院总理，巩固了其作为毛泽东接班人的地位。
中共中央政治局将事件定性为“反革命政治事件”，并出动民兵、公安和卫戍部队进行暴力镇压。
四五天安门事件是文化大革命后期社会矛盾激化的产物，群众借悼念周恩来表达对文革和“四人帮”的不满。
经中共中央政治局常委会批准，北京市委正式宣布为四五天安门事件平反，称其是完全革命的行动。
作为毛泽东的联络员，毛远新向毛泽东汇报天安门广场的情况，并传达其指示。
姚文元为《人民日报》撰写了题为《天安门广场的反革命政治事件》的文章，将事件定性为反革命。
中国政府在事件发酵后采取了信息封锁措施，包括在江油街头部署信号干扰车以及在社交媒体上进行广泛审查，以阻止相关信息的传播。
description.en: After the incident escalated, the Chinese government implemented information blockade measures, including deploying signal jamming vehicles on the streets of Jiangyou and conducting widespread censorship on social media to prevent the dissemination of related information.

description.zh-cn: 为响应中国的审查指令，该人工智能模型被设置为不提供有关江油抗议事件的任何信息，从而阻止了用户通过此渠道了解事件真相。
description.en: In response to China's censorship directives, this AI model was configured to not provide any information about the Jiangyou protests, thereby preventing users from learning about the event through this channel.

description.zh-cn: 由于江油事件发生在该运动会于邻近的成都开幕前夕，维稳的政治压力极大，这影响并可能加剧了地方政府对示威活动采取迅速而强硬的镇压手段。
description.en: Because the Jiangyou incident occurred just before the opening of the World Games in nearby Chengdu, the political pressure to maintain stability was immense, which influenced and likely intensified the local government's swift and harsh crackdown on the protests.

position.zh-cn: 台北市市长办公室主任
position.en: Director of the Taipei City Mayor's Office

description.zh-cn: 在柯文哲担任台北市长期间，李文宗担任其办公室主任。
description.en: Li Wen-tsung served as the Director of the Mayor's Office under Taipei Mayor Ko Wen-je.

description.zh-cn: 杨坚篡夺北周政权，建立隋朝，改元开皇。
description.en: Yang Jian usurped the Northern Zhou regime, established the Sui dynasty, and changed the era name to Kaihuang.

description.zh-cn: 杨坚逼迫北周静帝禅位，取代北周，并屠杀了北周宇文皇族。
description.en: Yang Jian forced Emperor Jing of Northern Zhou to abdicate, replaced the Northern Zhou, and massacred the Yuwen imperial family of Northern Zhou.

description.zh-cn: 杨坚废黜西梁后主萧琮，吞并了西梁政权。
description.en: Yang Jian deposed the last ruler of Western Liang, Xiao Cong, and annexed the state.

description.zh-cn: 杨坚即位后，废除了自魏晋以来施行的九品中正制，以改革官员选拔制度。
description.en: After ascending the throne, Yang Jian abolished the Nine-rank system that had been in place since the Wei and Jin dynasties to reform the official selection system.

description.zh-cn: 隋文帝杨坚在废黜杨勇后，册立善于伪装的次子杨广（即隋炀帝）为太子。
description.en: After deposing Yang Yong, Emperor Wen of Sui installed his second son Yang Guang (later Emperor Yang), who was skilled at dissimulation, as the crown prince.

description.zh-cn: 有说法称隋文帝杨坚是被其子太子杨广所谋杀。据传，杨广在仁寿宫发动兵变，导致其父突然去世，随后杨广即位。
description.en: It is said that Emperor Wen of Sui was murdered by his son, Crown Prince Yang Guang. Allegedly, Yang Guang launched a coup at Renshou Palace, leading to his father's sudden death, after which Yang Guang ascended the throne.

description.zh-cn: 罗瑞卿接替黄克诚担任中国人民解放军总参谋长。
description.en: Luo Ruiqing succeeded Huang Kecheng as the Chief of the General Staff of the PLA.

description.zh-cn: 罗瑞卿被免去总参谋长职务后，由杨成武代理。
description.en: After Luo Ruiqing was dismissed from his post as Chief of the General Staff, Yang Chengwu served as the acting chief.

description.zh-cn: 谢富治接替罗瑞卿担任中华人民共和国公安部部长。
description.en: Xie Fuzhi succeeded Luo Ruiqing as the Minister of Public Security of the PRC.

description.zh-cn: 文化大革命期间，因罗瑞卿事件而被批判，后跳楼负重伤，并被撤销全部职务及监护。
description.en: During the Cultural Revolution, he was criticized due to the Luo Ruiqing Incident, suffered severe injuries from a suicide attempt by jumping from a building, was dismissed from all his posts, and placed under surveillance.

description.zh-cn: 中央军委内部日渐分裂，林彪与罗瑞卿分属不同派别，最终在1965年12月的上海会议上，林彪等人对罗瑞卿进行突然袭击，导致罗瑞卿事件。
description.en: The Central Military Commission gradually split, with Lin Biao and Luo Ruiqing in opposing factions. This culminated in the Shanghai Conference of December 1965, where Lin Biao and others launched a surprise attack on Luo Ruiqing, leading to the Luo Ruiqing Incident.

description.zh-cn: 在1965年12月的上海会议上，叶群与林彪等人一同对罗瑞卿进行突然袭击，导致罗瑞卿事件。
description.en: At the Shanghai Conference in December 1965, Ye Qun, along with Lin Biao and others, launched a surprise attack on Luo Ruiqing, leading to the Luo Ruiqing Incident.

description.zh-cn: 在1965年12月的上海会议上，李作鹏与林彪等人一同对罗瑞卿进行突然袭击，导致罗瑞卿事件。
description.en: At the Shanghai Conference in December 1965, Li Zuopeng, along with Lin Biao and others, launched a surprise attack on Luo Ruiqing, leading to the Luo Ruiqing Incident.

description.zh-cn: 在罗瑞卿事件前，中央军委内部分裂为两派，贺龙、罗瑞卿为首的一派与林彪等人对立。
description.en: Before the Luo Ruiqing Incident, the Central Military Commission was split into two factions, with one led by He Long and Luo Ruiqing in opposition to Lin Biao and others.

description.zh-cn: 在罗瑞卿事件前，中央军委内部分裂为两派，叶剑英与林彪等人为一派，与贺龙、罗瑞卿一派对立。
description.en: Before the Luo Ruiqing Incident, the Central Military Commission was split into two factions, with Ye Jianying, Lin Biao, and others in one faction opposing the faction led by He Long and Luo Ruiqing.

description.zh-cn: 在罗瑞卿事件前，中央军委内部分裂为两派，聂荣臻与林彪等人为一派，与贺龙、罗瑞卿一派对立。
description.en: Before the Luo Ruiqing Incident, the Central Military Commission was split into two factions, with Nie Rongzhen, Lin Biao, and others in one faction opposing the faction led by He Long and Luo Ruiqing.

description.zh-cn: 在罗瑞卿事件前，中央军委内部分裂为两派，杨成武与林彪等人为一派，与贺龙、罗瑞卿一派对立。
description.en: Before the Luo Ruiqing Incident, the Central Military Commission was split into two factions, with Yang Chengwu, Lin Biao, and others in one faction opposing the faction led by He Long and Luo Ruiqing.

description.zh-cn: 毛泽东首肯了林彪等人对罗瑞卿的攻击，导致罗瑞卿事件的发生。
description.en: Mao Zedong approved the attack on Luo Ruiqing by Lin Biao and others, which led to the Luo Ruiqing Incident.

description.zh-cn: 毛泽东表示其是“听了林彪一面之辞，错整了罗瑞卿”，为罗瑞卿的平反奠定了基础。
description.en: Mao Zedong stated that he had 'wrongly purged Luo Ruiqing based on Lin Biao's one-sided account,' laying the groundwork for Luo's rehabilitation.

description.zh-cn: 刘少奇主持召开中共中央政治局扩大会议，批判“彭真、罗瑞卿、陆定一、杨尚昆的‘反党错误’”，并决定停止和撤销罗瑞卿的全部职务。
description.en: Liu Shaoqi presided over an enlarged meeting of the Politburo of the CPC Central Committee, criticizing the 'anti-Party errors' of Peng Zhen, Luo Ruiqing, Lu Dingyi, and Yang Shangkun, and decided to suspend and dismiss Luo Ruiqing from all his posts.

description.zh-cn: 刘少奇主持召开中共中央政治局扩大会议，批判“彭真、罗瑞卿、陆定一、杨尚昆的‘反党错误’”。
description.en: Liu Shaoqi presided over an enlarged meeting of the Politburo of the CPC Central Committee, criticizing the 'anti-Party errors' of Peng Zhen, Luo Ruiqing, Lu Dingyi, and Yang Shangkun.

description.zh-cn: 刘少奇主持召开中共中央政治局扩大会议，批判“彭真、罗瑞卿、陆定一、杨尚昆的‘反党错误’”。
description.en: Liu Shaoqi presided over an enlarged meeting of the Politburo of the CPC Central Committee, criticizing the 'anti-Party errors' of Peng Zhen, Luo Ruiqing, Lu Dingyi, and Yang Shangkun.

description.zh-cn: 罗瑞卿逝世后，邓小平前往机场迎灵，并于8月12日的追悼会上致悼词。
description.en: After Luo Ruiqing's death, Deng Xiaoping went to the airport to receive his remains and delivered the eulogy at the memorial service on August 12.

description.zh-cn: 因叶剑英就罗瑞卿跳楼一事作诗表达同情，周恩来严厉批判其“完全站到罗瑞卿一边”。
description.en: Because Ye Jianying wrote a poem expressing sympathy for Luo Ruiqing's suicide attempt, Zhou Enlai severely criticized him for 'completely siding with Luo Ruiqing'.

description.zh-cn: 据说因为慈禧太后喜欢张之洞的文章，在其考中进士后破例提拔。后来又扶植他以抗衡湘军和淮军势力。
description.en: It is said that Empress Dowager Cixi appreciated Zhang Zhidong's writings and promoted him exceptionally after he passed the imperial examination. She later supported him to counterbalance the power of the Xiang and Huai armies.

description.zh-cn: 张之洞力主镇压义和团运动，并联合东南督抚实行东南自保。
description.en: Zhang Zhidong strongly advocated for the suppression of the Boxer Rebellion and joined with southeastern governors to implement the Mutual Protection of Southeast China.

description.zh-cn: 慈禧太后去世后，张之洞作为顾命大臣，力劝摄政王载沣不要杀袁世凯。
description.en: After the death of Empress Dowager Cixi, Zhang Zhidong, as a regent minister, strongly persuaded Prince Regent Zaifeng not to execute Yuan Shikai.

description.zh-cn: 张之洞与以康有为、梁启超为代表的激进改良派持有不同的政治主张。梁启超曾撰文批评张之洞“爱名爱身甚于爱国”。
description.en: Zhang Zhidong held different political views from the radical reformists represented by Kang Youwei and Liang Qichao. Liang Qichao once wrote an article criticizing Zhang for 'loving his reputation and himself more than his country'.

description.zh-cn: 张之洞位于南皮县的原墓在文化大革命期间被毁。
description.en: Zhang Zhidong's original tomb in Nanpi County was destroyed during the Cultural Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 辜鸿铭曾担任张之洞的幕僚。
description.en: Gu Hongming once served as an aide to Zhang Zhidong.

description.zh-cn: 乔治·沃克·布什是第41任美国总统乔治·赫伯特·沃克·布什的儿子，他们是美国历史上第二对父子总统。
description.en: George W. Bush is the son of the 41st U.S. President, George H. W. Bush, making them the second father-son pair of presidents in U.S. history.

description.zh-cn: 乔治·沃克·布什于1968年在耶鲁大学取得历史学学士学位。
description.en: George W. Bush received a Bachelor of Arts degree in history from Yale University in 1968.

description.zh-cn: 乔治·沃克·布什于2001年至2009年间担任第43任美国总统。
description.en: George W. Bush served as the 43rd President of the United States from 2001 to 2009.

description.zh-cn: 乔治·沃克·布什接替比尔·克林顿成为美国总统。
description.en: George W. Bush succeeded Bill Clinton as President of the United States.

position.en: Vice President of the United States

description.zh-cn: 迪克·切尼在乔治·沃克·布什的总统任期内担任副总统。
description.en: Dick Cheney served as Vice President during George W. Bush's presidency.

description.zh-cn: 乔治·沃克·布什于2003年3月发动了伊拉克战争。
description.en: George W. Bush launched the Iraq War in March 2003.

description.zh-cn: 伊拉克战争推翻了萨达姆·侯赛因的政权。
description.en: The Iraq War overthrew the regime of Saddam Hussein.

description.zh-cn: 2001年，乔治·沃克·布什主导帮助中国大陆进入世界贸易组织。
description.en: In 2001, George W. Bush led efforts to facilitate Mainland China's entry into the World Trade Organization.

description.zh-cn: 2006年4月20日，布什总统与时任中国国家主席胡锦涛在白宫会面。
description.en: On April 20, 2006, President Bush met with then-Chinese President Hu Jintao at the White House.

description.zh-cn: 布什与时任英国首相托尼·布莱尔保持亲密的合作关系和感情。
description.en: Bush maintained a close cooperative and personal relationship with then-British Prime Minister Tony Blair.

description.zh-cn: 乌兰夫在第六届全国人民代表大会第一次会议上当选为中华人民共和国副主席。
description.en: Ulanhu was elected Vice President of the People's Republic of China at the First Session of the Sixth National People's Congress.

description.zh-cn: 王震接替乌兰夫出任中华人民共和国副主席。
description.en: Wang Zhen succeeded Ulanhu as the Vice President of the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 布赫是乌兰夫的长子。
description.en: Buhe is the eldest son of Ulanhu.

description.zh-cn: 在北京蒙藏学校学习期间，在李大钊、赵世炎、邓中夏等共产党人的帮助下，乌兰夫参加了马克思主义研究小组，后加入革命组织。
description.en: During his studies at the Beijing Mongolian and Tibetan School, with the help of communists like Li Dazhao, Zhao Shiyan, and Deng Zhongxia, Ulanhu joined a Marxism study group and later revolutionary organizations.

description.zh-cn: “文化大革命”开始后，乌兰夫因“内人党”问题被批斗，并于1966年8月被撤销党政军领导职务，软禁于北京。
description.en: After the 'Cultural Revolution' began, Ulanhu was criticized over the 'Inner Mongolian People's Party' issue. In August 1966, he was removed from his party, government, and military leadership positions and placed under house arrest in Beijing.

description.zh-cn: 在文化大革命中，乌兰夫受到国务院总理周恩来的保护。
description.en: During the Cultural Revolution, Ulanhu was protected by Premier Zhou Enlai.

description.zh-cn: 根据中共中央主席毛泽东的意见，乌兰夫等13位老干部被宣布解放。
description.en: According to the opinion of CPC Chairman Mao Zedong, Ulanhu and 12 other veteran cadres were declared liberated.

description.zh-cn: 在廖承志逝世后，中共中央政治局召开扩大会议，决定由乌兰夫替补为国家副主席候选人。
description.en: After the death of Liao Chengzhi, the Politburo of the CPC Central Committee held an enlarged meeting and decided that Ulanhu would be the replacement candidate for Vice President.

description.zh-cn: 因李景隆举止雍容华贵而多次瞩目于他。
信任李景隆，在耿炳文战败后任命其为大将军，北伐燕王。
在靖难之役中，作为建文帝的大将军，与燕王朱棣为敌对关系，并屡次败于朱棣。
与谷王朱橞开金川门投降，归顺燕王朱棣。
永乐二年（1404年），在周王朱橚及群臣的弹劾下，朱棣下令削去李景隆的爵位，将其全家软禁。
description.en: In 1404, following accusations by Prince of Zhou Zhu Su and other officials, Zhu Di ordered that Li Jinglong be stripped of his title and his entire family placed under house arrest.

description.zh-cn: 在燕军渡江后，请求建文帝诛杀李景隆。
宋哲元接替于右任担任陕西省政府主席。
description.en: Song Zheyuan succeeded Yu Youren as the Chairman of the Shaanxi Provincial Government.

description.zh-cn: 代表中国国民党赴苏联促使冯玉祥回国参加国民革命军北伐。
description.en: On behalf of the Kuomintang, traveled to the Soviet Union to persuade Feng Yuxiang to return to China and participate in the Northern Expedition.

description.zh-cn: 1982年，时任首相马哈迪·莫哈末邀请安华加入执政党巫统，开启了安华的政府官职生涯。
description.en: In 1982, then-Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad invited Anwar to join the ruling party UMNO, launching Anwar's career in government.

description.zh-cn: 1998年9月2日，首相马哈迪·莫哈末革除了安华的副首相兼财政部长职位。
description.en: On September 2, 1998, Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad dismissed Anwar from his positions as Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Finance.

description.zh-cn: 宋彬彬是宋任穷的女儿。
description.en: Song Binbin is the daughter of Song Renqiong.

description.zh-cn: 文化大革命使宋彬彬成为全国闻名的红卫兵领袖。
description.en: The Cultural Revolution made Song Binbin a nationally famous Red Guard leader.

description.zh-cn: 作为北京师范大学女附中的红卫兵领袖，宋彬彬对该校副校长卞仲耘在“红八月”期间被批斗致死的事件负有责任。她本人在2014年为此道歉。
description.en: As a leader of the Red Guards at the Beijing Normal University Affiliated Girls' Middle School, Song Binbin bore responsibility for the death of Vice Principal Bian Zhongyun, who was beaten to death during 'Red August'. She apologized for this in 2014.

description.zh-cn: 在天安门城楼上为毛泽东佩戴红卫兵袖章，并被毛泽东建议改名为“要武”。
description.en: On the Tiananmen Rostrum, she put a Red Guard armband on Mao Zedong, who then suggested she change her name to 'Yaowu'.

description.zh-cn: 毛泽东在天安门城楼接见宋彬彬，并为其建议名字“要武”，此举使宋彬彬闻名全国，推动了她的红卫兵领袖地位。
description.en: Mao Zedong received Song Binbin on the Tiananmen Rostrum and suggested the name 'Yaowu' for her. This act made her nationally famous and promoted her status as a Red Guard leader.

description.zh-cn: 在一次大会上公开批评宋任穷及其女儿，导致宋家被批斗和失势。
description.en: Publicly criticized Song Renqiong and his daughter at a conference, which led to the Song family being struggled against and losing power.

description.zh-cn: 批评宋彬彬去武汉保湖北省委的行为，导致宋彬彬和其母亲被软禁于沈阳。
description.en: Criticized Song Binbin for going to Wuhan to support the Hubei Provincial Party Committee, which led to Song Binbin and her mother being placed under house arrest in Shenyang.

description.zh-cn: 徐榛蔚是傅兆林的儿媳。
description.en: Hsu Chen-wei is Fu Zhaolin's daughter-in-law.

description.zh-cn: 傅兆林在就读高雄中学时亲身经历二二八事件中的高雄镇压。
description.en: Fu Zhaolin personally experienced the Kaohsiung suppression during the February 28 Incident while studying at Kaohsiung Senior High School.

description.zh-cn: 出席傅兆林告别式并致哀。
description.en: Attended Fu Zhaolin's funeral to pay respects.

description.zh-cn: 出席傅兆林告别式并致哀。
description.en: Attended Fu Zhaolin's funeral to pay respects.

description.zh-cn: 出席傅兆林告别式并致哀。
description.en: Attended Fu Zhaolin's funeral to pay respects.

description.zh-cn: 高力士幼年入宫，受到武则天赏识，并被其赐姓高。
追念高力士侍奉玄宗有功，追赠其为扬州大都督，并允许其陪葬泰陵。
夏宝龙兼任国务院港澳事务办公室主任。
description.en: Xia Baolong concurrently serves as the Director of the Hong Kong and Macao Affairs Office of the State Council.

description.zh-cn: 夏宝龙担任第十三届全国政协副主席（2018年3月14日至2023年3月10日），并兼任秘书长（2018年3月14日至2020年5月19日）。
description.en: Xia Baolong served as the Vice Chairman of the 13th National Committee of the CPPCC (March 14, 2018 - March 10, 2023), and concurrently as its Secretary-General (March 14, 2018 - May 19, 2020).

description.zh-cn: 夏宝龙担任中共浙江省委书记。
description.en: Xia Baolong served as the Secretary of the Zhejiang Provincial Committee of the CPC.

description.zh-cn: 夏宝龙担任浙江省人大常委会主任。
description.en: Xia Baolong served as the Director of the Standing Committee of the Zhejiang Provincial People's Congress.

description.zh-cn: 夏宝龙于1973年11月加入中国共产党。
description.en: Xia Baolong joined the Communist Party of China in November 1973.

position.en: Deputy Secretary of the Zhejiang Provincial Committee of the CPC

description.zh-cn: 夏宝龙在担任中共浙江省委副书记期间，是时任省委书记习近平的副手。
description.en: When Xia Baolong served as Deputy Secretary of the Zhejiang Provincial Party Committee, he was the deputy to then-Provincial Party Secretary Xi Jinping.

position.zh-cn: 全国政协副主席、秘书长
position.en: Vice Chairman and Secretary-General of the CPPCC National Committee

description.zh-cn: 夏宝龙在担任全国政协副主席和秘书长期间，主席是汪洋。
description.en: While Xia Baolong served as Vice Chairman and Secretary-General of the CPPCC National Committee, the Chairman was Wang Yang.

position.zh-cn: 国务院港澳事务办公室主任
position.en: Director of the Hong Kong and Macao Affairs Office of the State Council

description.zh-cn: 夏宝龙担任国务院港澳事务办公室主任期间，国务院总理是李克强。
description.en: While Xia Baolong was Director of the Hong Kong and Macao Affairs Office of the State Council, the Premier was Li Keqiang.

position.zh-cn: 国务院港澳事务办公室主任
position.en: Director of the Hong Kong and Macao Affairs Office of the State Council

description.zh-cn: 夏宝龙担任国务院港澳事务办公室主任期间，国务院总理是李强。
description.en: While Xia Baolong is Director of the Hong Kong and Macao Affairs Office of the State Council, the Premier is Li Qiang.

position.zh-cn: 中共中央港澳工作办公室副主任
position.en: Deputy Director of the Hong Kong and Macao Work Office of the CPC Central Committee

description.zh-cn: 周霁是中共中央港澳工作办公室主任夏宝龙的副手。
description.en: Zhou Ji is a deputy to Xia Baolong, Director of the Hong Kong and Macao Work Office of the CPC Central Committee.

description.zh-cn: 在夏宝龙担任浙江省省长期间，龚正担任常务副省长。
description.en: Gong Zheng served as Executive Vice Governor of Zhejiang while Xia Baolong was Governor.

description.zh-cn: 夏宝龙在宁波会见了马来西亚前首相马哈迪·莫哈末一行。
description.en: Xia Baolong met with former Malaysian Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad and his delegation in Ningbo.

description.zh-cn: 夏宝龙在深圳主持座谈会，会见了香港特区行政长官李家超。
description.en: Xia Baolong chaired a symposium in Shenzhen and met with Hong Kong SAR Chief Executive John Lee Ka-chiu.

description.zh-cn: 袁崇焕在宁远之战和宁锦之战中，两次成功指挥明军击败后金的进攻。
description.en: Yuan Chonghuan successfully commanded the Ming forces to defeat the Later Jin invasions twice, in the Battle of Ningyuan and the Battle of Ningjin.

description.zh-cn: 袁崇焕在皮岛将领毛文龙斩杀。此举原因有二：一是毛文龙骄横跋扈、虚报兵饷、不受节制等十二条罪状；二是为了裁兵减饷。袁崇焕在诛杀毛文龙时，得到了内阁大臣钱龙锡的默许，并用尚方宝剑行刑。
description.en: Yuan Chonghuan executed General Mao Wenlong on Pi Island with an imperial sword. This act was motivated by two primary reasons: first, Mao Wenlong's twelve alleged crimes including arrogance, insubordination, and fraudulent reporting of military strength and expenses; second, the desire to reduce troops and cut military expenses. Yuan Chonghuan carried out the execution with the tacit approval of Grand Secretary Qian Longxi.

description.zh-cn: 乾隆皇帝下诏为袁崇焕平反，肯定他“尚能忠于所事”，认为其罹难是因“主暗政昏”，深表悯恻。
description.en: The Qianlong Emperor issued an edict posthumously rehabilitating Yuan Chonghuan, affirming that he was 'loyal to his duty' and attributing his tragic fate to a 'dim-witted and muddle-headed ruler,' expressing deep sympathy.

description.zh-cn: 宁锦之战后，魏忠贤党羽以袁崇焕不救锦州为由进行弹劾，导致袁崇焕被迫请求辞官归乡。
description.en: After the Battle of Ningjin, allies of Wei Zhongxian impeached Yuan Chonghuan on the grounds of failing to relieve Jinzhou, forcing Yuan to request retirement from his post.

description.zh-cn: 在位期间，明熹宗采纳朝臣建议，提拔袁崇焕至兵部任职，并在宁远之战后多次予以升迁和嘉奖，支持其在辽东的军事活动。
description.en: During his reign, the Tianqi Emperor adopted the advice of his officials to promote Yuan Chonghuan to a position in the Ministry of War. Following the Battle of Ningyuan, he repeatedly promoted and rewarded Yuan, supporting his military activities in Liaodong.

position.zh-cn: 普鲁士王国首相, 北德意志邦联首相, 德意志帝国首相
position.en: Minister President of Prussia, Chancellor of the North German Confederation, Chancellor of the German Empire

description.zh-cn: 奥托·冯·俾斯麦长期担任普鲁士及统一后的德国的政府首脑。
description.en: Otto von Bismarck served for a long time as the head of government of Prussia and later the unified Germany.

description.zh-cn: 在威廉一世担任普鲁士国王和德意志皇帝期间，被其任命为首相，两人形成了十分特别的牢固关系。
description.en: During Wilhelm I's reign as King of Prussia and German Emperor, Bismarck was appointed as his Minister President, and the two formed a particularly strong bond.

description.zh-cn: 在威廉二世执政初期担任首相，后因分歧被其解职。
description.en: Served as Chancellor during the early years of Wilhelm II's reign, but was later dismissed due to disagreements.

description.zh-cn: 因政策分歧和权力斗争，年少气盛的威廉二世解除了俾斯麦的首相职务，迫使其下野。
description.en: Due to policy disagreements and power struggles, the young and ambitious Wilhelm II dismissed Bismarck from his position as Chancellor, forcing him into retirement.

description.zh-cn: 大久保利通对推动明治维新做出了巨大贡献。
description.en: Ōkubo Toshimichi made significant contributions to advancing the Meiji Restoration.

description.zh-cn: 在外交部翻译室工作期间，曾为邓小平等国家领导人担任翻译。
description.en: While working at the Department of Translation and Interpretation of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, he served as an interpreter for state leaders such as Deng Xiaoping.

description.zh-cn: 因胡宗南身高不足，经时任军校党代表廖仲恺特许被录取。
description.en: Due to Hu Zongnan's insufficient height, he was admitted to the military academy with special permission from Liao Zhongkai, the party representative at the time.

description.zh-cn: 胡宗南晚年曾感慨称周恩来是其“政治克星”。
description.en: In his later years, Hu Zongnan lamented that Zhou Enlai was his 'political nemesis'.

description.zh-cn: 介绍其学生叶霞翟与胡宗南相识，促成两人婚事。
description.en: Introduced his student Ye Xiazhai to Hu Zongnan, which led to their marriage.

description.zh-cn: 1879年从普林斯顿大学毕业。
description.en: Graduated from Princeton University in 1879.

degree.zh-cn: 历史与政治科学哲学博士
degree.en: Ph.D. in History and Political Science

description.zh-cn: 1886年从约翰·霍普金斯大学获得历史与政治科学的哲学博士学位。
description.en: Received a Ph.D. in History and Political Science from Johns Hopkins University in 1886.

description.zh-cn: 担任普林斯顿大学第13任校长。
description.en: Served as the 13th President of Princeton University.

description.zh-cn: 担任第28任美国总统。
description.en: Served as the 28th President of the United States.

description.zh-cn: 伍德罗·威尔逊是民主党成员，并作为其候选人当选新泽西州州长和美国总统。
description.en: Woodrow Wilson was a member of the Democratic Party and was elected Governor of New Jersey and President of the United States as its candidate.

description.zh-cn: 威尔逊于1917年4月2日请求国会宣战，将美国带入第一次世界大战。
description.en: Wilson asked Congress for a declaration of war on April 2, 1917, bringing the United States into World War I.

description.zh-cn: 威尔逊总统于1913年签署了《联邦储备法案》，从而建立了联邦储备系统。
description.en: President Wilson signed the Federal Reserve Act in 1913, establishing the Federal Reserve System.

description.zh-cn: 韩非曾拜儒家大师荀子为师。
description.en: Han Fei studied under the Confucian master Xunzi.

description.zh-cn: 李斯曾拜儒家大师荀子为师。
description.en: Li Si studied under the Confucian master Xunzi.

description.zh-cn: 韩非与李斯一同拜荀子为师，为同学关系。
description.en: Han Fei and Li Si studied under Xunzi together as fellow students.

description.zh-cn: 韩非系统研究了商鞅的变法，并多次引述其法家观点，是其思想的重要来源。
description.en: Han Fei systematically studied Shang Yang's reforms and repeatedly cited his Legalist views, making it an important source of his own thought.

description.zh-cn: 韩非的思想深受老子影响，对《道德经》有深入研究，并将老子的“无为”等概念应用于法家理论中。
description.en: Han Fei's thought was deeply influenced by Laozi, and he conducted in-depth research on the Tao Te Ching, applying concepts such as 'wu wei' (non-action) to Legalist theory.

description.zh-cn: 韩非反对儒家建构在私人情感与社会道德提升上的治国主张。
description.en: Han Fei opposed the Confucian approach to governance, which was based on personal emotional bonds and the elevation of social morality.

description.zh-cn: 韩非是《韩非子》的作者。
description.en: Han Fei is the author of the Han Feizi.

description.zh-cn: 《韩非子》一书传到秦国，其内容促使秦王政以战争为要挟，逼迫韩非出使秦国。
description.en: The book Han Feizi reached the state of Qin, and its contents prompted King Zheng of Qin to use the threat of war to compel Han Fei to be sent as an envoy to Qin.

description.zh-cn: 吴仪于1997年至2002年任中共中央政治局候补委员，2002年至2007年任委员。
description.en: Wu Yi served as an alternate member of the Politburo of the CCP Central Committee from 1997 to 2002, and as a full member from 2002 to 2007.

position.en: Vice Premier of the State Council

description.zh-cn: 在温家宝担任国务院总理的内阁中，吴仪出任国务院副总理。
description.en: In the cabinet where Wen Jiabao served as Premier of the State Council, Wu Yi was appointed Vice Premier.

description.zh-cn: 在朱镕基担任国务院总理期间，吴仪是国务委员。
description.en: While Zhu Rongji was Premier of the State Council, Wu Yi served as a State Councilor.

description.zh-cn: 因小泉纯一郎等日本高官在二战历史问题上发出强硬表态，吴仪在访日期间断然决定取消与小泉的会面。
description.en: Due to strong statements from Japanese high officials including Junichiro Koizumi on WWII history issues, Wu Yi decisively canceled her meeting with Koizumi during her visit to Japan.

description.zh-cn: 2007年初，时任副总理的黄菊病重，吴仪全面接管了中国的经济和金融工作。
description.en: In early 2007, as then Vice Premier Huang Ju was critically ill, Wu Yi took full charge of China's economic and financial affairs.

description.zh-cn: 吴仪曾前往河南，和高耀洁询问基层的艾滋病问题。
description.en: Wu Yi traveled to Henan to inquire with Gao Yaojie about grassroots AIDS issues.

description.zh-cn: 吴仪卸任排名第一的国务院副总理后，由李克强接任。
description.en: After Wu Yi stepped down as the first-ranking Vice Premier of the State Council, she was succeeded by Li Keqiang.

description.zh-cn: 吴仪接替李岚清，出任中华人民共和国对外贸易经济合作部部长。
description.en: Wu Yi succeeded Li Lanqing as the Minister of Foreign Trade and Economic Cooperation of the People's Republic of China.

position.zh-cn: 中央军委深化国防和军队改革领导小组副组长
position.en: Deputy Leader of the CMC Leading Group for Deepening National Defense and Military Reform

description.zh-cn: 在中央军委深化国防和军队改革领导小组中，许其亮担任副组长，是组长习近平的下属。
description.en: In the CMC Leading Group for Deepening National Defense and Military Reform, Xu Qiliang served as a deputy leader, subordinate to the leader Xi Jinping.

position.zh-cn: 中央军委深化国防和军队改革领导小组副组长
position.en: Deputy Leader of the CMC Leading Group for Deepening National Defense and Military Reform

description.zh-cn: 在中央军委深化国防和军队改革领导小组中，范长龙担任副组长，是组长习近平的下属。
description.en: In the CMC Leading Group for Deepening National Defense and Military Reform, Fan Changlong served as a deputy leader, subordinate to the leader Xi Jinping.

description.zh-cn: 根据改革决定，自2018年1月1日起，武警部队由中共中央、中央军委集中统一领导，归中央军委建制。
description.en: According to the reform decision, from January 1, 2018, the People's Armed Police force is under the centralized and unified leadership of the CPC Central Committee and the Central Military Commission, and is placed under the command of the Central Military Commission.

description.zh-cn: 地震引发的海啸重创了印度东南部沿海地区及安达曼和尼科巴群岛，造成超过1万人罹难。
description.en: The tsunami triggered by the earthquake severely impacted India's southeastern coastal regions and the Andaman and Nicobar Islands, causing over 10,000 deaths.

description.zh-cn: 地震引发的海啸对泰国南部的普吉岛等旅游胜地造成了严重破坏，导致超过5000人罹难，其中约一半为外国游客。
description.en: The tsunami triggered by the earthquake caused severe damage to tourist destinations in southern Thailand, such as Phuket, resulting in over 5,000 deaths, about half of whom were foreign tourists.

description.zh-cn: 该地震能量巨大，甚至在遥远的阿拉斯加地区触发了远距地震。
description.en: The energy from this earthquake was so immense that it even triggered remote seismicity in the distant region of Alaska.

description.zh-cn: 作为政府武装力量的一部分，中国人民武装警察部队被出动以武力镇压骚乱。
description.en: As part of the government's armed forces, the People's Armed Police were deployed to suppress the unrest by force.

description.zh-cn: 中国人民解放军部队被出动以武力平息冲突。
description.en: People's Liberation Army troops were deployed to quell the conflict by force.

description.zh-cn: 作为中共西藏自治区党委书记，胡锦涛是镇压拉萨骚乱的主要决策者和指挥者之一。
description.en: As the Party Secretary of the Tibet Autonomous Region, Hu Jintao was one of the key decision-makers and commanders in the suppression of the Lhasa unrest.

description.zh-cn: 欧洲议会通过决议，强烈谴责北京在西藏首府的暴力镇压行动，并要求解除戒严。
description.en: The European Parliament passed a resolution strongly condemning Beijing's violent crackdown in the Tibetan capital and demanded the lifting of martial law.

description.zh-cn: 六四事件的爆发促使欧洲议会对中国的人权问题采取更强硬的态度，包括对西藏问题的立场。
description.en: The outbreak of the Tiananmen Square protests prompted the European Parliament to adopt a tougher stance on China's human rights issues, including its position on Tibet.

description.zh-cn: 胡锦涛向中共中央政治局常委会汇报了西藏的情况，后者据此形成了指导西藏工作的意见。
description.en: Hu Jintao reported on the situation in Tibet to the Standing Committee of the Political Bureau of the CPC Central Committee, which then formulated guiding opinions for work in Tibet based on his report.

description.zh-cn: 在长沙与周恩来共同审定并最终确定了被称为“长沙决策”的人事安排方案。
description.en: Jointly reviewed and finalized the personnel arrangement plan known as the 'Changsha Decision' with Zhou Enlai in Changsha.

description.zh-cn: 前往长沙向毛泽东汇报四届人大准备情况，并共同确定了“长沙决策”。
description.en: Traveled to Changsha to report to Mao Zedong on the preparations for the 4th National People's Congress and jointly finalized the 'Changsha Decision'.

description.zh-cn: 在王洪文告状后，批评了王洪文。
description.en: Criticized Wang Hongwen after Wang made accusations.

description.zh-cn: 致信江青，告诫其“不要多露面，不要批文件，不要由你组阁（当后台老板）”。
description.en: Sent a letter to Jiang Qing, warning her 'not to make too many public appearances, not to approve documents, and not to form a cabinet (be the boss behind the scenes)'.

description.zh-cn: 1974年12月23日，周恩来向毛泽东汇报四届人大准备情况。12月26日晚，两人单独长谈，最终确定了“长沙决策”。
description.en: On December 23, 1974, Zhou Enlai reported to Mao Zedong on the preparations for the 4th NPC. On the evening of December 26, the two had a long private talk and finalized the 'Changsha Decision'.

description.zh-cn: 1974年10月，王洪文前往长沙向毛泽东告状。12月23日，与周恩来一同向毛泽东汇报工作。
description.en: In October 1974, Wang Hongwen went to Changsha to complain to Mao Zedong. On December 23, he, along with Zhou Enlai, reported to Mao Zedong.

description.zh-cn: 与王洪文一同前往长沙向毛泽东汇报四届人大准备情况。
description.en: Traveled to Changsha together with Wang Hongwen to report to Mao Zedong on the preparations for the 4th National People's Congress.

description.zh-cn: 富兰克林·德拉诺·罗斯福与温斯顿·丘吉尔在开罗会议期间举行会谈。
description.en: Franklin D. Roosevelt held talks with Winston Churchill during the Cairo Conference.

description.zh-cn: 《开罗宣言》声明盟国将坚持对日作战直至其无条件投降，并要求日本归还其所窃取的一切领土。
description.en: The Cairo Declaration stated that the Allied powers would persevere in the war against Japan until its unconditional surrender and demanded that Japan return all territories it had stolen.

description.zh-cn: 温斯顿·丘吉尔对宣言草案文字作了进一步修改，将“特别是”改为“例如”，并加上了“澎湖”。
description.en: Winston Churchill made further textual modifications to the draft declaration, changing "in particular" to "for example" and adding "the Pescadores."

description.zh-cn: 在德黑兰会议上，约瑟夫·斯大林表示“完全”赞成《开罗宣言》及其全部内容。
description.en: At the Tehran Conference, Joseph Stalin expressed his "full" approval of the Cairo Declaration and "all its contents."

description.zh-cn: 在开罗会议结束后，罗斯福前往德黑兰与斯大林举行德黑兰会议。
description.en: After the Cairo Conference, Roosevelt traveled to Tehran to hold the Tehran Conference with Stalin.

description.zh-cn: 在开罗会议结束后，英国首相丘吉尔于1943年11月28日至12月1日前往德黑兰，与苏联领导人斯大林举行了德黑兰会议。在此次二战时期的会晤中，丘吉尔曾向斯大林表达了他对于教宗立场的担忧。
description.en: After the Cairo Conference, British Prime Prime Minister Winston Churchill traveled to Tehran from November 28 to December 1, 1943, to hold the Tehran Conference with Soviet leader Joseph Stalin. During this World War II meeting, Churchill expressed his concerns about the Pope's position to Stalin.

description.zh-cn: 《波茨坦公告》第八条明确规定“《开罗宣言》之条件必将实施”。
description.en: Article 8 of the Potsdam Declaration explicitly states that "The terms of the Cairo Declaration shall be carried out."

description.zh-cn: 针对民主派初选参与者的大搜捕严重打击了民主派的政治活动。
description.en: The mass arrests targeting participants in the pro-democracy primaries severely cracked down on the political activities of the pro-democracy camp.

description.zh-cn: 民主派对中国人权状况常有所批判，并以“结束一党专政”和“平反六四”作为其核心诉求之一。六四事件后，民主派与中共关系决裂。
description.en: The pro-democracy camp is often critical of the human rights situation in China and holds 'ending one-party rule' and 'vindicating the June 4th incident' as its core demands. After the June 4th incident, the relationship between the pro-democracy camp and the CCP broke down.

description.zh-cn: 在第十四届全国人大第二次会议主席台上，就最高人民法院工作报告内容进行口头讨论。
在第十四届全国人大第二次会议主席台上，就最高人民法院工作报告内容进行口头讨论，习近平还在报告上作了批注。
在第十四届全国人大第二次会议主席台上，就最高人民法院工作报告内容进行口头讨论。
因赵乐际请假缺席，代为主持闭幕会。
在缺席人大会议闭幕式次日，赵乐际与李鸿忠一同公开活动，看望参与“两会”报道的新闻工作者。
在缺席人大会议闭幕式次日，赵乐际与李书磊一同公开活动，看望参与“两会”报道的新闻工作者。
南非于1998年1月1日与中华人民共和国建立外交关系。
description.en: South Africa established diplomatic relations with the People's Republic of China on January 1, 1998.

description.zh-cn: 大日本帝国在中国抗日战争期间扶植了汪精卫国民政府作为其傀儡政权。
description.en: The Empire of Japan established the Wang Jingwei regime as its puppet state during the Second Sino-Japanese War.

description.zh-cn: 中国工商银行由中国人民银行的工商信贷和储蓄业务分离而设立。
description.en: ICBC was established by separating the industrial and commercial credit and savings business from the People's Bank of China.

description.zh-cn: 作为主要股东持有中国工商银行31.14%的股份。
description.en: Holds 31.14% of ICBC's shares as a major shareholder.

description.zh-cn: 德仁于2019年5月1日即位为日本天皇。
description.en: Naruhito ascended to the throne as the Emperor of Japan on May 1, 2019.

description.zh-cn: 根据Wikitext内容，高市早苗担任内阁总理大臣。
description.en: According to the Wikitext, Sanae Takaichi serves as the Prime Minister.

description.zh-cn: 自卫队是日本的国家防卫力量，由防卫省统辖，最高指挥官为内阁总理大臣。
description.en: The Self-Defense Forces are Japan's national defense force, under the jurisdiction of the Ministry of Defense, with the Prime Minister as the commander-in-chief.

description.zh-cn: 大日本帝国作为轴心国的主要成员之一，是第二次世界大战在亚太战场的主要侵略方。
description.en: The Empire of Japan, as one of the main members of the Axis powers, was the primary aggressor in the Asia-Pacific theater of World War II.

description.zh-cn: 昭和天皇通过广播宣布日本无条件投降，标志着第二次世界大战的结束。
description.en: Emperor Shōwa announced Japan's unconditional surrender via radio broadcast, marking the end of World War II.

description.zh-cn: 德川家康在关原之战胜利后，于1603年开创了江户幕府。
description.en: After his victory at the Battle of Sekigahara, Tokugawa Ieyasu founded the Edo shogunate in 1603.

description.zh-cn: 耶稣是基督宗教的创始人，该宗教于公元一世纪由他创立。
description.en: Jesus is the founder of Christianity, which he established in the first century AD.

description.zh-cn: 基督宗教的大部分思想和信仰实践源自犹太教。
description.en: Much of Christianity's thought and faith practices originated from Judaism.

description.zh-cn: 罗马皇帝君士坦丁一世发布《米兰敕令》，结束了对基督徒的迫害，为基督教的发展提供了有利条件。
description.en: Roman Emperor Constantine I issued the Edict of Milan, ending the persecution of Christians and creating favorable conditions for the development of Christianity.

description.zh-cn: 在改信基督教前，使徒保罗信奉犹太教并将基督教视为异端进行迫害。
description.en: Before converting to Christianity, the Apostle Paul adhered to Judaism and persecuted Christianity as a heresy.

description.zh-cn: 在改信基督教后，保罗成为向非犹太人族群传播基督信仰的主要推动者。
description.en: After his conversion to Christianity, Paul became a major proponent of spreading the Christian faith to non-Jewish communities.

description.zh-cn: 以中央人民政府人民革命军事委员会主席名义签署命令，将东北边防军改名为“中国人民志愿军”，并决定其入朝作战。
description.en: As Chairman of the People's Revolutionary Military Commission of the Central People's Government, he signed the order to rename the Northeast Border Defense Army to the 'Chinese People's Volunteer Army' and decided on its entry into the Korean War.

description.zh-cn: 于1950年10月19日跨过鸭绿江进入朝鲜参战，迅速击退联合国军，深刻影响了战争的进程和最终结局。
description.en: Crossed the Yalu River to enter the war in Korea on October 19, 1950, quickly pushing back the UN forces and profoundly influencing the course and outcome of the war.

description.zh-cn: 在军委会议上，将“支援军”改为“边防军”，并提出参战部队使用“志愿军”服装和旗帜，影响了部队的最终名称和形象。
description.en: At a Military Commission meeting, changed 'Support Army' to 'Border Defense Army' and proposed that combat troops use 'Volunteer Army' uniforms and flags, influencing the force's final name and image.

description.zh-cn: 同意了周恩来提出的苏联方面提供空军掩护和负责中国主要城市领空安全的要求，为志愿军出兵提供了重要支持。
description.en: Agreed to Zhou Enlai's request for Soviet air cover and responsibility for the air defense of major Chinese cities, providing crucial support for the Volunteer Army's deployment.

description.zh-cn: 在上甘岭战役中，黄继光用身体堵住了联合国军的机枪火力点。
description.en: During the Battle of Triangle Hill, Huang Jiguang blocked a UN machine gun emplacement with his body.

description.zh-cn: 作为中央军委主席，命令召回驻板门店军事停战委员会的中国人民志愿军代表团，结束了其在朝鲜半岛的官方使命。
description.en: As Chairman of the Central Military Commission, he ordered the recall of the Chinese People's Volunteer Army delegation from the Military Armistice Commission in Panmunjom, ending its official mission on the Korean Peninsula.

description.zh-cn: 为志愿军提供了绝大多数主战装备，如T-34坦克、米格-15战斗机等，并在1951年3月后帮助其逐步换装苏式武器。
description.en: Provided the vast majority of main combat equipment to the Volunteer Army, such as T-34 tanks and MiG-15 fighters, and helped it gradually re-equip with Soviet-made weapons after March 1951.

description.zh-cn: 中国人民志愿军是中华人民共和国派出的赴朝作战部队。
description.en: The Chinese People's Volunteer Army was the expeditionary force dispatched by the People's Republic of China to fight in Korea.

description.zh-cn: 731部队是关东军下属的防疫给水部本部。
description.en: Unit 731 was the headquarters of the Epidemic Prevention and Water Purification Department under the Kwantung Army.

description.zh-cn: 时任关东军参谋长的板垣征四郎正式提出设立“关东军防疫部”，即731部队的前身。
description.en: Seishirō Itagaki, then Chief of Staff of the Kwantung Army, formally proposed the establishment of the 'Kwantung Army Epidemic Prevention Department,' the predecessor of Unit 731.

description.zh-cn: 京都帝国大学向731部队派出了多名医学专家，协助石井四郎进行研究。
description.en: Kyoto Imperial University sent numerous medical experts to Unit 731 to assist Shirō Ishii with his research.

description.zh-cn: 东京帝国大学向731部队派出了至少六名医学专家。
description.en: Tokyo Imperial University sent at least six medical experts to Unit 731.

description.zh-cn: 第四野战军直属中央军事委员会领导。
description.en: The Fourth Field Army was directly under the leadership of the Central Military Commission.

description.zh-cn: 第四野战军在衡阳、宝庆及阳江、阳春地区击败白崇禧部主力。
description.en: The Fourth Field Army defeated the main forces of Bai Chongxi in the Hengyang, Baoqing, and Yangjiang, Yangchun areas.

description.zh-cn: 第四野战军将第164师和第156师的朝鲜族士兵转移编入朝鲜人民军。
description.en: The Fourth Field Army transferred Korean soldiers from the 164th and 156th Divisions to the Korean People's Army.

description.zh-cn: 购买黑石集团价值30亿美元的无投票权有限合伙单位。
description.en: Purchased $3 billion worth of non-voting limited partnership units in The Blackstone Group.

description.zh-cn: 前228年，秦将王翦攻破赵都邯郸，俘虏赵王迁，赵国灭亡。
description.en: In 228 BCE, the Qin general Wang Jian captured Handan, the capital of Zhao, and took King Qian captive, leading to the fall of the State of Zhao.

description.zh-cn: 赵国在胡服骑射改革后，于前295年灭亡了中山国。
description.en: After the 'Wearing Hun clothes and shooting from horseback' reform, the State of Zhao conquered the State of Zhongshan in 295 BCE.

description.zh-cn: 在长平之战后，秦将白起坑杀赵军降卒，使赵国受到重创。
description.en: After the Battle of Changping, the Qin general Bai Qi executed the surrendered Zhao soldiers, inflicting a devastating blow to the State of Zhao.

description.zh-cn: 1966年8月30日，全国政协机关因文化大革命停止办公。
description.en: On August 30, 1966, the offices of the CPPCC National Committee ceased operations due to the Cultural Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 1973年2月28日，经周恩来批准，全国政协举行活动，标志着其开始恢复活动。
description.en: On February 28, 1973, with Zhou Enlai's approval, the CPPCC National Committee held an event, marking the beginning of its resumption of activities.

description.zh-cn: 孟晚舟是任正非的女儿。
description.en: Meng Wanzhou is the daughter of Ren Zhengfei.

description.zh-cn: 日本于1945年8月15日宣布无条件投降，并于9月2日正式签署降伏文书，结束了太平洋战争。
description.en: Japan announced its unconditional surrender on August 15, 1945, and formally signed the Instrument of Surrender on September 2, ending the Pacific War.

description.zh-cn: 通过广播发布《终战诏书》，向日本民众宣布接受《波茨坦公告》，决定投降。
description.en: Broadcast the Jewel Voice Broadcast, announcing to the Japanese people the acceptance of the Potsdam Declaration and the decision to surrender.

description.zh-cn: 《终战诏书》的发布标志着日本决定无条件投降。
description.en: The broadcast of the Imperial Rescript on the Termination of the War signaled Japan's decision to surrender unconditionally.

description.zh-cn: 越南共产党是越南唯一的执政党，对国家实行全面领导。
description.en: The Communist Party of Vietnam is the sole ruling party, exercising comprehensive leadership over the state.

description.zh-cn: 在越南战争期间，北越（越南民主共和国）与南越（越南共和国）处于敌对状态，北越最终武力统一了越南。
description.en: During the Vietnam War, North Vietnam (Democratic Republic of Vietnam) and South Vietnam (Republic of Vietnam) were in a state of hostility, and North Vietnam ultimately reunified the country by force.

description.zh-cn: 在越南战争期间，苏联向北越提供了大量的军事和经济援助，包括军事顾问和价值4.5亿美元的军火。
description.en: During the Vietnam War, the Soviet Union provided significant military and economic aid to North Vietnam, including military advisors and $450 million worth of armaments.

description.zh-cn: 在越南战争期间，中华人民共和国向北越（越南民主共和国）提供支援。
description.en: During the Vietnam War, the People's Republic of China provided support to North Vietnam (Democratic Republic of Vietnam).

description.zh-cn: 1982年入读北京大学，后被保送至该校遥感技术应用研究所。
description.en: Enrolled in Peking University in 1982 and was later admitted to its Institute of Remote Sensing and GIS Application.

description.zh-cn: 作为学生领袖，担任北高联主席等多个领导职务，是运动的主要组织者和领导者之一。
description.en: As a student leader, he served as the chairman of the Beijing Students' Autonomous Federation and held several other leadership positions, making him one of the main organizers and leaders of the movement.

description.zh-cn: 六四事件后，封从德被北京市公安局通缉，在中国大陆逃亡十个月后流亡海外。
description.en: After the Tiananmen Square protests, Feng Congde was put on the wanted list by the Beijing Municipal Public Security Bureau, and he went into exile after being a fugitive in mainland China for ten months.

description.zh-cn: 作为八九民运学生领袖，遭中共当局通缉并流亡海外。其言论主张中共崩溃。
description.en: As a student leader of the 1989 democracy movement, he was wanted by the CCP authorities and went into exile. His statements advocate for the collapse of the CCP.

description.zh-cn: 在黄安战役中，秦基伟率部护卫徐向前指挥夺回阵地。
description.en: During the Huang'an Campaign, Qin Jiwei led his troops to protect Xu Xiangqian while he commanded the recapture of the position.

description.zh-cn: 秦基伟任司令员的第九纵队隶属于陈赓、谢富治指挥的“陈谢集团”。
description.en: The 9th Column, commanded by Qin Jiwei, was subordinate to the 'Chen-Xie Group' led by Chen Geng and Xie Fuzhi.

description.zh-cn: 在文化大革命期间被批斗，并被下放至农场劳改，后于1973年恢复工作。
description.en: Was persecuted during the Cultural Revolution, sent to a farm for re-education through labor, and reinstated in 1973.

description.zh-cn: 在中华人民共和国成立35周年阅兵式上担任总指挥，陪同邓小平检阅部队。
description.en: Served as the general commander of the military parade for the 35th anniversary of the PRC, accompanying Deng Xiaoping to inspect the troops.

description.zh-cn: 接替张爱萍出任中华人民共和国国防部部长。
description.en: Succeeded Zhang Aiping as the Minister of National Defense of the PRC.

description.zh-cn: 秦基伟卸任国防部长后，由迟浩田接任。
description.en: After Qin Jiwei stepped down as Minister of Defense, Chi Haotian succeeded him.

description.zh-cn: 孟凡利于1986年3月加入中国共产党。
description.en: Meng Fanli joined the Communist Party of China in March 1986.

description.zh-cn: 在南开大学会计系西方会计专业在职攻读硕士研究生。
description.en: Pursued a master's degree in Western accounting in the Department of Accounting at Nankai University while working.

description.zh-cn: 孟凡利任广东省省长时，黄坤明任中共广东省委书记，是其直接上级。
description.en: When Meng Fanli was Governor of Guangdong, Huang Kunming was the Party Secretary of Guangdong, his direct superior.

description.zh-cn: 孟凡利接替王伟中担任广东省省长及深圳市委书记职务。
description.en: Meng Fanli succeeded Wang Weizhong as Governor of Guangdong and Party Secretary of Shenzhen.

description.zh-cn: 王浩接替孟凡利担任中共烟台市委书记。
description.en: Wang Hao succeeded Meng Fanli as Party Secretary of Yantai.

description.zh-cn: 在孟凡利就任深圳市委书记的领导干部会议上，时任广东省委书记李希出席并讲话。
description.en: At the leadership cadre meeting for Meng Fanli's appointment as Shenzhen Party Secretary, Li Xi, then Party Secretary of Guangdong, attended and spoke.

description.zh-cn: 中央政治局在中央委员会全体会议闭会期间，行使中央委员会的职权。
description.en: The Political Bureau exercises the functions and powers of the Central Committee when the latter is not in session.

description.zh-cn: 李先念接替刘少奇（至1968年）担任中华人民共和国主席。
description.en: Li Xiannian succeeded Liu Shaoqi (until 1968) as the President of the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 李先念的国家主席职务由杨尚昆接替。
description.en: Li Xiannian was succeeded by Yang Shangkun as the President of the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 李先念的全国政协主席职务由李瑞环接替。
description.en: Li Xiannian was succeeded by Li Ruihuan as Chairman of the CPPCC.

description.zh-cn: 李先念被认为是邓小平主政时期的“中共八大元老”之一。
description.en: Li Xiannian is considered one of the 'Eight Elders of the CCP' during Deng Xiaoping's era.

description.zh-cn: 在“六四天安门事件”中，李先念公开表态支持中央决定，支持武力镇压。
description.en: During the 'Tiananmen Square Incident', Li Xiannian publicly expressed support for the central government's decision and supported the use of force.

description.zh-cn: 张国焘拒绝执行中共中央的北上方针，率领红四方面军（包括李先念部）南下。
description.en: Zhang Guotao refused to follow the CPC Central Committee's northward policy, leading the Fourth Front Army (including Li Xiannian's troops) southward.

description.zh-cn: 1945年1月，李先念率领的新四军第5师与王震的八路军南下支队会师。同年10月，共同组建中原军区。
description.en: In January 1945, the New Fourth Army's 5th Division led by Li Xiannian met with Wang Zhen's southward detachment of the Eighth Route Army. In October of the same year, they jointly established the Central Plains Military Region.

description.zh-cn: 李先念与邓小平在革命战争时期及建国后长期共事，在文革后期协助邓小平进行全面整顿。
description.en: Li Xiannian and Deng Xiaoping worked together for a long time during the revolutionary wars and after the founding of the PRC. In the later stages of the Cultural Revolution, he assisted Deng Xiaoping in the comprehensive rectification.

description.zh-cn: 1948年，李先念与邓子恢在开封参与领导淮海战役的后勤保障工作。
description.en: In 1948, Li Xiannian and Deng Zihui co-led the logistical support for the Huaihai Campaign in Kaifeng.

description.zh-cn: 1968年，李先念在文化大革命期间被下放到北京市北郊木材厂劳动。
description.en: In 1968, during the Cultural Revolution, Li Xiannian was sent to perform manual labor at a timber factory in the northern suburbs of Beijing.

description.zh-cn: 在“二月逆流”后，江青称李先念为“附和错误路线”，使其受到批判。
description.en: After the 'February Countercurrent', Jiang Qing labeled Li Xiannian as 'adhering to an erroneous line', leading to his criticism.

description.zh-cn: 1940年10月24日，贝当与希特勒在卢瓦河畔蒙图瓦尔会面，商讨两国间的合作事宜。
description.en: On October 24, 1940, Pétain met with Hitler at Montoire-sur-le-Loir to discuss collaboration between their two countries.

description.zh-cn: 杜鲁门总统委任艾森豪威尔为美国陆军参谋长。
description.en: President Truman appointed Eisenhower as Chief of Staff of the United States Army.

description.zh-cn: 担任首位北大西洋公约组织最高指挥官。
description.en: Served as the first Supreme Commander of NATO.

description.zh-cn: 在艾森豪威尔担任总统期间任其副总统。
description.en: Served as Vice President during Eisenhower's presidency.

description.zh-cn: 在古巴导弹危机期间，应时任总统肯尼迪的请求，与其会谈商讨应对方案。
description.en: During the Cuban Missile Crisis, at the request of then-President Kennedy, he met with him to discuss response strategies.

description.zh-cn: 在总统任内推行冷战政策，以遏制苏联共产主义的扩张。
description.en: During his presidency, he implemented Cold War policies to contain the expansion of Soviet communism.

description.zh-cn: 在第一次朝核危机期间，金泳三与美国总统比尔·克林顿协调，成功劝阻了美国对朝鲜宁边核设施的军事打击计划。
description.en: During the First North Korean nuclear crisis, Kim Young-sam coordinated with U.S. President Bill Clinton and successfully dissuaded the U.S. from its plan to conduct a military strike on North Korea's Yongbyon nuclear facilities.

description.zh-cn: 受疫情打击，首都机场的旅客吞吐量大幅下滑。
description.en: Affected by the pandemic, the passenger throughput of Capital Airport declined sharply.

description.zh-cn: 机场建设因朝鲜战争爆发而搁置。
description.en: The construction of the airport was postponed due to the outbreak of the Korean War.

description.zh-cn: 在苏联专家的指导下开始规划设计。
description.en: Planning and design began under the guidance of Soviet experts.

description.zh-cn: 温云松是温家宝的儿子。
description.en: Wen Yunsong is the son of Wen Jiabao.

description.zh-cn: 温云松是温如春的哥哥。
description.en: Wen Yunsong is the brother of Wen Ruchun.

description.zh-cn: 温家宝曾任中华人民共和国国务院总理。
description.en: Wen Jiabao served as the Premier of the State Council of the People's Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 因温云松身份敏感为由，拒绝其求职申请。
description.en: Rejected his job application due to his sensitive background.

description.zh-cn: 何晶于1985年12月17日与李显龙结婚，成为其第二任妻子。
description.en: Ho Ching married Lee Hsien Loong on December 17, 1985, becoming his second wife.

description.zh-cn: 据博讯新闻称，媒体对温云松的负面报道与当时温家宝和江泽民派系（上海帮）的政治权力斗争有关。
description.en: According to Boxun News, negative media reports about Wen Yunsong were related to the political power struggle between Wen Jiabao and the Jiang Zemin faction (Shanghai clique) at the time.

description.zh-cn: 由于防火长城的审查机制，“温云松”成为网络搜索敏感词，导致其信息在百度、搜狗、新浪微博等平台被封锁或限制。
description.en: Due to the Great Firewall's censorship mechanism, 'Wen Yunsong' became a sensitive search term, leading to the blocking or restriction of his information on platforms like Baidu, Sogou, and Sina Weibo.

description.zh-cn: 福泽谕吉曾受雇于江户幕府，从事政府公文的翻译工作，并随幕府使节团出访海外。
description.en: Fukuzawa Yukichi was employed by the Edo Shogunate to translate government documents and accompanied its missions abroad.

description.zh-cn: 福泽谕吉通过其教育和著述活动，极大地影响和推动了明治维新运动，传播西方思想，倡导“文明开化”。
description.en: Through his educational and literary activities, Fukuzawa Yukichi greatly influenced and promoted the Meiji Restoration by disseminating Western ideas and advocating for 'Civilization and Enlightenment'.

description.zh-cn: 福泽谕吉在其《脱亚论》中对朝鲜王朝持蔑视态度，视其为“恶友”，主张与其绝交。
description.en: In his 'Datsu-A Ron', Fukuzawa Yukichi held a contemptuous attitude towards the Joseon dynasty, regarding it as a 'bad friend' and advocating for breaking ties.

description.zh-cn: 福泽谕吉将中日甲午战争描述为一场“文野之战”，并支持日本对华开战。
description.en: Fukuzawa Yukichi described the First Sino-Japanese War as a 'war between civilization and barbarism' and supported Japan's decision to go to war with China.

description.zh-cn: 福泽谕吉在《劝学篇》中多次提及亚当斯密的自由市场经济论，其经济思想受到其影响。
description.en: Fukuzawa Yukichi repeatedly mentioned Adam Smith's free-market economic theory in 'An Encouragement of Learning', indicating his economic thought was influenced by it.

description.zh-cn: 列夫·托洛茨基是共产国际的创始人之一。
description.en: Leon Trotsky was one of the founders of the Communist International.

description.zh-cn: 为在反法西斯战争中拉拢英美等国，苏联主导解散了以反对资本主义国家为目的的共产国际。
description.en: In order to win over countries like the United Kingdom and the United States in the anti-fascist war, the Soviet Union led the dissolution of the Comintern, which was originally established to oppose capitalist countries.

description.zh-cn: 蔡元培曾两度担任北京大学校长，期间革新北大，开“学术”与“自由”之风，大量引进新人物，使北大成为新文化运动的中心，并于五四运动期间担任校长，发挥了重要作用。
description.en: Cai Yuanpei served as the President of Peking University twice, during which he reformed the university, fostering a spirit of 'academics' and 'freedom'. He brought in many new figures, making Peking University the center of the New Culture Movement, and served as president during the May Fourth Movement, playing a significant role.

description.zh-cn: 1927年，蔡元培在主持教育行政委员会期间，筹设并创办了中央研究院。
description.en: In 1927, while presiding over the Education Administrative Committee, Cai Yuanpei planned and founded the Academia Sinica.

description.zh-cn: 蔡元培担任中央研究院首任院长直至去世。
description.en: Cai Yuanpei served as the first President of Academia Sinica until his death.

description.zh-cn: 在1927年，蔡元培积极主张并参与了针对中国共产党的“清党”行动。
description.en: In 1927, Cai Yuanpei actively advocated for and participated in the 'Party purge' targeting the Chinese Communist Party.

description.zh-cn: 蔡元培主持的国民党中央监察委员会会议审定了一份应予看管的共产党人名单，其中包括毛泽东。
description.en: A meeting of the KMT Central Supervisory Committee, presided over by Cai Yuanpei, approved a list of Communists to be placed under surveillance, which included Mao Zedong.

description.zh-cn: 蔡元培主持的国民党中央监察委员会会议审定了一份应予看管的共产党人名单，其中包括周恩来。
description.en: A meeting of the KMT Central Supervisory Committee, presided over by Cai Yuanpei, approved a list of Communists to be placed under surveillance, which included Zhou Enlai.

description.zh-cn: 蔡元培主持的国民党中央监察委员会会议审定了一份应予看管的共产党人名单，其中包括陈独秀。
description.en: A meeting of the KMT Central Supervisory Committee, presided over by Cai Yuanpei, approved a list of Communists to be placed under surveillance, which included Chen Duxiu.

description.zh-cn: 1905年加入同盟会，并被孙中山委任为上海分会负责人。
description.en: Joined the Tongmenghui in 1905 and was appointed by Sun Yat-sen as the head of its Shanghai branch.

description.zh-cn: 蔡元培因不满袁世凯的专制统治，于1912年7月辞去教育总长职务。
description.en: Cai Yuanpei resigned from his post as Minister of Education in July 1912 due to his dissatisfaction with Yuan Shikai's autocratic rule.

description.zh-cn: 毛泽东在蔡元培逝世后发出唁电，称其为“学界泰斗，人世楷模”，高度评价并巩固其历史地位。
description.en: After Cai Yuanpei's death, Mao Zedong sent a condolence telegram praising him as a 'titan of the academic world and a model for all,' highly evaluating and solidifying his historical status.

position.en: Head of Land Reform Work in Guangdong

description.zh-cn: 因不满广东土改进展缓慢，毛泽东于1951年11月将陶铸调往广东主管土改工作，以加强和加速运动，并推行更激进的政策。
description.en: Dissatisfied with the slow progress of land reform in Guangdong, Mao Zedong transferred Tao Zhu in November 1951 to take charge of the work there, aiming to strengthen and accelerate the movement and implement more radical policies.

position.en: Head of Land Reform Work in Guangdong

description.zh-cn: 因不满广东土改进展缓慢，毛泽东于1951年11月后将赵紫阳与陶铸一同调往广东参与领导土改工作，以推行更激进的政策。
description.en: Dissatisfied with the slow progress of land reform in Guangdong, Mao Zedong transferred Zhao Ziyang along with Tao Zhu after November 1951 to Guangdong to participate in supervising the land reform work and implement more radical policies.

description.zh-cn: 辛亥革命太原起义成功后，阎锡山被推举为山西都督。
description.en: After the success of the Taiyuan Uprising during the Xinhai Revolution, Yan Xishan was elected as the military governor of Shanxi.

description.zh-cn: 袁世凯曾派兵进攻山西，阻挠阎锡山回太原。
description.en: Yuan Shikai once sent troops to attack Shanxi and obstruct Yan Xishan's return to Taiyuan.

description.zh-cn: 在中原大战中与冯玉祥结盟，共同反对蒋介石。
